clinical_study.brief_title: Perfusion Index in the Success of Peripheral Nerve Block
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Perfusion Index in the Success of Peripheral Nerve Block in Advanced Age Patients

brief_summary.textblock: After a successful peripheral nerve block, blockade of sympathetic nerve fibers results in local vasodilatation, increased local blood flow, and increased skin temperature.Increased permeability index; Can be used as a reliable tool for evaluating block activity.

study_pop.textblock: Elective orthopedic lower extremity surgery patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 65 years old
- ASA I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 65 years old
- Patients contraindicated in regional anesthesia
- Patients with local anesthetic allergy
- Patients with injection site infection
- Patients who do not accept the procedure
